thread.title: Duterte set to sign PH consent to Paris Agreement
thread.title_full: Duterte set to sign PH consent to Paris Agreement

author: cbibe
title: Duterte set to sign PH consent to Paris Agreement

organizations.name: joint climate change commission board meeting

text:
READ: Duterte to uphold Paris agreement 
National Economic and Development Authority (Neda) Director General Ernesto Pernia, who was present at the meeting on Tuesday, said Duterte asked his Cabinet members to comment on why it was important for the Philippines to join the Paris agreement. 
“The president asked (Finance Secretary Sonny) Dominguez to comment, (Budget Secretary Benjamin) Diokno to comment, me to comment, Yasay to comment. And the others also raised their hand to comment,” Pernia said during an interview with INQ&A on Tuesday evening. 
“Nobody objected. We were all in favor of ratification,” Pernia said. 
The Neda head said they discussed the country’s access to the climate fund. “My comment was that, whether or not we get access to a climate fund, we will not lose anything by being a member,” he said. “We might as well not want to be left out.” 
Duterte left before the meeting ended to attend the oathtaking of Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP) officials and asked Senator Loren Legarda to take over as chair. 
De Guzman, on the other hand, said there was “no such expressed worry” on the part of the President. 
The Philippines was among the countries that pushed for the approval of the Paris Agreement and the inclusion of provisions beneficial to climate vulnerable countries during the 2015 climate change negotiations in France. CBB President Rodrigo Roa Duterte presides over the Joint Climate Change Commission Board Meeting at the State Dining Room of Malacañan Palace on January 31, 2017. Also in the photo are Interior and Local Government Secretary Ismael Sueno, Labor Secretary Silvestre Bello III, and Senator Loren Legarda. Photo courtesy of Malacañang
